By doing this, I hope to play my part in mitigating the spread of the virus and #SlowingTheSpread.

Dear Employer,

I am writing to express my concern regarding the Covid-19 vaccine and the prospect of mandatory vaccine passports in the workplace.

As an individual, it is my fundamental right to make my own health decisions, including whether or not to be vaccinated against any illness. While I believe in the importance of public health and safety, I also value the autonomy of my body and personal medical choices.

The decision to decline the Covid-19 vaccine or vaccine passport is not based on any personal interests or beliefs. It is a matter of my personal choice and my right to medical privacy. Therefore, I must respectfully decline any requirement to take the vaccine or produce a vaccine passport as a condition of my employment.

I understand that employers have a responsibility to take measures that ensure the safety and well-being of employees and customers, but I believe that there are alternative ways to achieve this without infringing on individual rights.

Thank you for your understanding and consideration.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]

To understand the effectiveness of vaccines against new variants of COVID-19, a sports analogy can be helpful. Imagine if tennis champion Serena Williams was suddenly 50% less effective due to some magical intervention. Even with this reduction, she would still be able to easily defeat amateur players. Similarly, although new variants of the virus may cause a decrease in the effectiveness of vaccines, they still offer significant protection against severe illness and death.
